content: Bank Account Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Oct 2018How do I fill up the W-8BEN form from Singapore to invest in US stocks?I recently tried logging in through my Standard chartered online banking account but was denied the option to invest in US stocks as I had to fill up this form. I was abit confused so I was hoping someone can share with me how to fill this up?3 answersAnswerBumped5
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 21 Oct 2018You can go down to the bank and get them to assist you step by step. They will tell you which area to write and how to write it. Usually must write in capitals and address must have certain format.0 comments0
Prakash KumaraswamiLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 16 Oct 2018Walk down to a branch open all 7 days and sign the w8ben form. Typically 8-10 days should have account enabled.0 comments0

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 22 Aug 2019Oh! I literally filled this up a few weeks back. Anyway, yes the terms look really confusing and complicated.But actually you will only need to fill up the top and bottom parts for Singaporean citizens/PR.I have attached a screenshot attached of a mock form filled up!If you need more details you can find them here!0 comments0
